intro: Acrocarpidium molle, commonly known as the soft acrocarp, is a unique member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers that are typically arranged in umbels, a common feature in the carrot family. Its leaves are often hairy and have a mild, aromatic scent. Acrocarpidium molle is typically found in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories.
